event.title: the death of his son, Emmett Butler, who on December 26, 1884

data.event: Helena is a ghost town allegedly because of the vendetta of Colonel William G. Butler (1831â€“1912) had against the town he blamed for the death of his son, Emmett Butler, who on December 26, 1884, was killed by a stray bullet from a saloon brawl.

event.title: A few days later, Colonel Butler went

data.event: A few days later, Colonel Butler went to Helena with group of cowhands and demanded to know who had shot his son and found that none of the townspeople was willing to tell the truth.
Then, in a bitterly contested election in 1894 the county seat was moved from Helena to Karnes City.
